Example: Mama i tata poszli do sklepu.
Translation: Mom and dad went to the store.
I like coffee and tea.

Example: On czyta książkę i słucha muzyki.
Translation: He is reading a book and listening to music.

Example: Ja lubię kawę, a ona herbatę.
Translation: I like coffee, and she likes tea.
He is working, and I’m resting.
The sun is shining, and the wind is blowing.

Example: Chciałem iść na spacer, ale pada deszcz.
Translation: I wanted to go for a walk, but it’s raining.

Example: To jest tanie, ale niezbyt dobre.
Translation: It’s cheap, but not very good.

Example: Próbował, ale mu się nie udało.
Translation: He tried, but he didn’t succeed.

Example: Prosiłem o pomoc, lecz nikt nie przyszedł.
Translation: I asked for help, but no one came.
He wanted to say something, but fell silent.
It’s nice, but a bit cold.
He bought milk as well as bread.
They discussed politics and the economy.
I work in the office and remotely.
Do you want coffee or tea?
I don’t know if he’ll come.
I wonder whether it’s possible.
You can choose pizza or pasta.
Go on foot or take the bus.
Do it today or tomorrow.

Example: Ani ja, ani on nie wiedzieli.
Translation: Neither I nor he knew.

Example: Nie chcę ani kawy, ani herbaty.
Translation: I want neither coffee nor tea.

Example: Ani nie zadzwonił, ani nie napisał.
Translation: He neither called nor wrote.
He didn’t go because he was tired.
I ate a lot because I was hungry.
She’s crying because something hurts.
He called when I was leaving the house.
When I was a child, I lived here.
She laughed when she heard it.

Example: Nie mogę iść, gdyż jestem chory.
Translation: I can't go because I am sick.

Example: On nie przyszedł, gdyż był zajęty.
Translation: He didn’t come because he was busy.
I stayed home, for it was raining.
Although it’s raining, they went for a walk.

Example: Choć się bała, weszła do pokoju.
Translation: Even though she was afraid, she entered the room.
Though he was tired, he kept working.

Example: Chociaż nie miał czasu, pomógł mi.
Translation: Although he didn’t have time, he helped me.
Even though I had a headache, I came.
Although it’s hard, I’ll try.
I know that he is lying.
She said that she would come later.
I'm glad that you're here.
I didn’t go because I was sick.
Since he didn’t reply, I called.
Since you're new, I’ll help you.
I waited until he came.
He screamed until he lost his voice.
He ran until he fell.
It was late, so I went to sleep.
He’s hungry, so he made a sandwich.

Example: Nie mam pieniędzy, więc nie kupię.
Translation: I have no money, so I won’t buy it.

Example: Nie ma go, zatem musimy poczekać.
Translation: He’s not here, so we have to wait.

Example: Skoro nie chcesz, zatem nie musisz.
Translation: Since you don’t want to, you don’t have to.
So what will we do?
Since you're already here, let's start.

Example: Skoro nie chce, niech nie przychodzi.
Translation: If he doesn’t want to, he doesn’t have to come.
As that’s true, we must act.

Example: Chciałem pomóc, tylko nie wiedziałem jak.
Translation: I wanted to help, only I didn’t know how.

Example: To nie to, tylko coś innego.
Translation: It's not that, but something else.
I came only for a moment.
I wanted to go, but it was raining.

Example: On próbował, lecz mu się nie udało.
Translation: He tried, yet he failed.
I like tea, but I prefer coffee.

Example: Nie uczył się, toteż oblał egzamin.
Translation: He didn’t study, hence he failed the exam.

Example: Pada, toteż nie idziemy na spacer.
Translation: It’s raining, so we’re not going for a walk.
I was in a hurry, so I forgot.

Example: Miał rację, jednak nikt go nie słuchał.
Translation: He was right, yet no one listened.
I wanted to go, however I stayed.
It's nice, yet chilly.

Example: Lubię ją, ale czasem mnie denerwuje.
Translation: I like her, but she sometimes annoys me.
I'd like to help, but I can't.
He’s talented but lazy.
He didn’t come because he was tired.

Example: Nie zjadłem, bo nie miałem apetytu.
Translation: I didn’t eat because I wasn’t hungry.
Because this is important!
Either you or I will go.
Take this or that.
Either you’ll come or not.
I don't know whether he will come.
Do you want coffee or tea?

Example: Zastanawiam się, czy to ma sens.
Translation: I’m wondering whether it makes sense.

Example: Nie było prądu, dlatego nie mogliśmy pracować.
Translation: There was no power, therefore we couldn’t work.

Example: Padało mocno, dlatego zostałem w domu.
Translation: It rained heavily, therefore I stayed home.

Example: Zgubiłem klucze, dlatego spóźniłem się do pracy.
Translation: I lost my keys, therefore I was late to work.
He is stronger than me.
I prefer coffee to tea.

Example: To zajmie więcej czasu niż myślałem.
Translation: It will take more time than I thought.

Example: Mimo że padało, poszliśmy na spacer.
Translation: Although it was raining, we went for a walk.

Example: Mimo że był zmęczony, pracował do późna.
Translation: Although he was tired, he worked late.

Example: Mimo że nie lubię kawy, spróbowałem.
Translation: Although I don’t like coffee, I tried it.

Example: Pomimo że było zimno, wyszliśmy na dwór.
Translation: Despite it being cold, we went outside.
Despite the rain, we continued working.

Example: Pomimo że miałem dużo pracy, pomogłem.
Translation: Despite having a lot of work, I helped.

Example: Jeśli będzie padać, zostanę w domu.
Translation: If it rains, I will stay home.
If you want, we can go together.
If I have time, I will visit you tomorrow.
As long as there is light, I will read.

Example: Dopóki pracujesz, możesz liczyć na moją pomoc.
Translation: As long as you work, you can count on my help.
As long as we live, we have hope.
I will wait as long as you come back.
Study as long as you understand.

Example: Dopóty nie odpuszczaj, dopóki nie osiągniesz celu.
Translation: Don’t give up as long as you don’t reach your goal.
I study in order to pass the exam.
We work hard in order to achieve success.
I did it in order to help you.
He said it so that he would entertain us.
I will stay longer so that I finish the project.
I came earlier so that I could prepare everything.

Example: Pójdę na spacer, o ile nie będzie padać.
Translation: I will go for a walk, provided that it doesn’t rain.

Example: Zgadzam się, o ile wszyscy będą szczęśliwi.
Translation: I agree, provided that everyone is happy.

Example: Możesz przyjść, o ile skończysz pracę na czas.
Translation: You can come, provided that you finish work on time.
Just like you said, it was easy.

Example: On tańczy tak jak jego ojciec.
Translation: He dances just like his father.
I cook just like mom.
Before I go to sleep, I read a book.
Before I started work, I took a break.
Before we leave, close the windows.
If you were here, it would be easier.
If it rained, we would stay at home.
If you asked me, I would help you.
Where have you been so long?
Where did the keys go?
Where is your mind?
I prefer tea rather than coffee.
He is smarter than you think.
I prefer walking than driving.

Example: Zjadłem obiad, po czym poszedłem na spacer.
Translation: I ate dinner, after which I went for a walk.

Example: Oglądałem film, po czym poszedłem spać.
Translation: I watched a movie, after which I went to sleep.

Example: Rozmawialiśmy długo, po czym się rozstaliśmy.
Translation: We talked for a long time, after which we parted ways.

Example: Nie poszedłem, ponieważ że byłem chory.
Translation: I didn’t go because I was sick.

Example: Zostałem w domu, ponieważ że padał deszcz.
Translation: I stayed home because it was raining.

Example: Odmówiłem, ponieważ że nie miałem czasu.
Translation: I declined because I didn’t have time.
He was cooking, meanwhile she was cleaning.

Example: Ja czytałem książkę, tymczasem dzieci bawiły się w parku.
Translation: I was reading a book, meanwhile the kids were playing in the park.

Example: Siedziałem w domu, tymczasem oni pracowali na dworze.
Translation: I was sitting at home, meanwhile they were working outside.
Before you start, you must prepare.
Before we leave, check the weather forecast.
Before we go, let’s talk.
He said it so that we would calm down.
I came so that I could help.
He stayed late so that he could finish the task.

Example: Byle nie padało, pójdziemy na spacer.
Translation: Provided that it doesn’t rain, we will go for a walk.
Provided that you are happy.
Provided that it’s quiet, don’t disturb.

Example: Jako że był zmęczony, poszedł spać.
Translation: Since he was tired, he went to sleep.

Example: Jako że nie było prądu, nie mogliśmy pracować.
Translation: Since there was no power, we couldn’t work.

Example: Jako że padało, zostaliśmy w domu.
Translation: Since it was raining, we stayed home.

Example: Lubię kawę. Co więcej, piję ją codziennie.
Translation: I like coffee. Moreover, I drink it every day.

Example: On jest dobrym uczniem. Co więcej, pomaga innym.
Translation: He is a good student. Moreover, he helps others.

Example: Zrobiłem zadanie. Co więcej, poprawiłem kilka błędów.
Translation: I did the homework. Moreover, I corrected some mistakes.

Example: Ja lubię kawę, natomiast on woli herbatę.
Translation: I like coffee, whereas he prefers tea.

Example: Ona jest wysoka, natomiast on niski.
Translation: She is tall, whereas he is short.

Example: Lubię zimę, natomiast on woli lato.
Translation: I like winter, whereas he prefers summer.
